snippet: Market shifts and exits of large insurers are leaving Obamacare customers with no-frills plans that limit their choices of doctors and hospitals....
abstract: The Upshot; analyses are showing that typical marketplace health care plan under Affordable Care Act resembles Medicaid, only with high deductible; it covers only small number of low-cost doctors and hospitals, and offers fewer frills than employer plans.
lead_paragraph: Market shifts and exits of large insurers are leaving Obamacare customers with no-frills plans that limit their choices of doctors and hospitals.

headline.print_headline: Affordable Care Act Plans Aren’t Like Employer Ones
headline.main: Think Your Obamacare Plan Will Be Like Employer Coverage? Think Again

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
